bibl.title: From Alexandria to Babylon. Near Eastern Languages and Hellenistic Erudition in the Oxyrhynchus Glossary (P. Oxy. 1802 + 4812).

series.title: Sozomena. Studies in the Recovery of Ancient Texts.

bibl.note: P. Oxy. XV, 1802 (= M.-P.3 2127; LDAB 5091). - Preface. - 1. Introduction. - 2. The Manuscript. - 3. Content. - 4. Dating and Origin. - 5. Near Eastern Glosses and the Problem of Their Acquisition. - 6. The Oxyrhynchus Glossary and Greek Glossography. - 7. Authorship. - 8. Edition. - 9. Commentary. - 10. Conclusions. - Old and New Numeration of the Oxyrhynchus Glossary. Fragments. Bibliography. Indices.
bibl.seg: SCHIRONI Francesca, From Alexandria to Babylon. Near Eastern Languages and Hellenistic Erudition in the Oxyrhynchus Glossary (P. Oxy. 1802 + 4812). (Sozomena. Studies in the Recovery of Ancient Texts. 4.)
Berlin - New York, W. de Gruyter, 2009, 8°, x-176 pp., 14 pll. ISBN 978-3-11-020693-7. €58.

P. Oxy. XV, 1802 (= M.-P.3 2127; LDAB 5091). - Preface. - 1. Introduction. - 2. The Manuscript. - 3. Content. - 4. Dating and Origin. - 5. Near Eastern Glosses and the Problem of Their Acquisition. - 6. The Oxyrhynchus Glossary and Greek Glossography. - 7. Authorship. - 8. Edition. - 9. Commentary. - 10. Conclusions. - Old and New Numeration of the Oxyrhynchus Glossary. Fragments. Bibliography. Indices.
C.R. par T.V. Evans, CR N.S., 60 (2010) pp. 415-417.
